description: The clinical trials this patient has or is participating in.

element.definition: The clinical trials this patient has or is participating in.
element.short: The patient's participation in clinical trials

element.definition: The National Clinical Trial number. The format for the US ClinicalTrials.gov registry number is "NCT" followed by an 8-digit number, e.g.: NCT00000419.
element.name: NCT

element.definition: The start and end times of the participation of this patient in the clinical trial.
element.name: period
element.short: The period of participation in the clinical trial

element.definition: The indication or reason the patient is part of this trial.
element.name: reason
element.short: The reason for participation in the clinical trial

element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
The National Clinical Trial number. The format for the US ClinicalTrials.gov registry number is "NCT" followed by an 8-digit number, e.g.: NCT00000419.
element.name: NCT

element.name: extension

element.comments: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition should be version specific.  This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
